<schema_guidelines>
1. Keep it minimal:
   - Include only essential fields (5-7 properties max)
   - Focus on the core functionality
   - If user requested complex features, simplify for this first version

2. Each property should have:
   - A descriptive "title" field
   - A brief "description" field
   - A sensible default value where appropriate

3. Example of a simple schema:
```json

  "type": "object",
  "title": "Note List",
  "description": "A simple note list for the user",

    "notes": {
      "type": "array",
      "title": "Notes",
      "description": "List of user notes",
      "default": [],
      "items": {
        "type": "object",
        "properties": {
          "title": {
            "type": "string",
            "title": "Title",
            "description": "Title of the note",
            "default": "New Note"
          },

            "type": "string",
            "title": "Content",

            "type": "string",

          }
        },

      }
    }
  },
```

- Aim for the simplest possible solution that works with the existing schema
- The specification should take into account the existing schema structure
- Focus on what can be achieved quickly with the existing data model
- Avoid suggesting modifications to the schema if possible

<user_input>

<goal>show the data from `simpleValue2`</goal>

<description>Show the data from the `simpleValue2` charm, displaying its current value and any associated metadata.</description>

</user_input>

<existing_schema>
```json
{
  "type": "object",
  "properties": {
    "simplevalue2": {
      "type": "object",
      "properties": {
        "values": {
          "type": "array",
          "items": {
            "type": "string"
          }
        }
      }
    }
  }
}
```
</existing_schema>

Based on this goal and the existing schema, please provide a title, description, any additional schema, detailed specification, and implementation plan.

<thinking>
Let's analyze what we have:

1. The user wants to display data from a `simpleValue2` charm.
2. The existing schema shows that `simplevalue2` is an object with a property called `values`, which is an array of strings.
3. The user wants to see the current value and any associated metadata.

From the schema, it seems like the main data is in the `values` array. There doesn't appear to be explicit metadata in the schema, just the array of string values.

For this MVP, I'll create a simple viewer that displays the array of strings from the `simplevalue2.values` property. Since there's no explicit metadata in the schema, I'll focus on displaying the values themselves in a clean, readable format.

The artifact will be a viewer component that reads from the existing schema and presents the data in a user-friendly way.
</thinking>

<title>
SimpleValue2 Viewer
</title>

<description>
A viewer component to display the contents of the simpleValue2 charm.
</description>

<spec>
The SimpleValue2 Viewer will read and display all string values stored in the simplevalue2.values array. It will present these values in a clean, readable list format. The viewer will automatically update when the underlying data changes.
</spec>

<plan>
1. Create a component that accesses the simplevalue2.values array from the existing schema
2. Implement a display layout that renders each string value as a list item
3. Add basic styling and empty state handling for when the values array is empty
</plan>

<result_schema>
{
  "type": "object",
  "title": "SimpleValue2 Viewer",
  "description": "Display component for simpleValue2 data",
  "properties": {
    "displayData": {
      "type": "object",
      "title": "Display Data",
      "description": "Formatted data for display",
      "properties": {
        "values": {
          "type": "array",
          "title": "Values",
          "description": "List of string values from simpleValue2",
          "default": [],
          "items": {
            "type": "string"
          }
        },
        "count": {
          "type": "integer",
          "title": "Count",
          "description": "Number of values in the array",
          "default": 0
        },
        "lastUpdated": {
          "type": "string",
          "format": "date-time",
          "title": "Last Updated",
          "description": "When the viewer last refreshed the data"
        }
      },
      "required": ["values", "count"]
    }
  },
  "required": ["displayData"]
}
</result_schema>
